<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sai](/Weapons.aspx?ID=59)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Disarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=175" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Versatile B" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=200" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 281 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) For the purposes of Pathfinder Society play, choosing the following region as a Home Region (or with the World Traveler boon) grants access this item: Jinin, Minkai, Shokuro_

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 6 sp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Knife](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=9)
</row>

</column>

---

This piercing dagger is a metal spike flanked by a pair of prongs that can be used to trap an enemy’s weapon.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-9" />
name: Sai
